result.execSummary:
The defendant Broderick A Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Pay all of the following by the 9/21/2017.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment: all court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA; all applicable fees of supervision.  Cash bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count two.  Credit for eight (8) days.

Court advised defendant  that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; also advised that his voting rights are suspended ad may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one. Credit for eight (8) days.
Each count, count one and two:  Day Reporting and huber privileges.  Good time.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Broderick A Moore

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bail refund check packet. DZ

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve  6 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 8 days credit CONCURRENT to COUNT 2., Day Reporting and Huber privileges, good time. 

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve  6 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 8 days credit CONCURRENT to COUNT 1., Day Reporting and Huber privileges, good time. 

Court order defendant to provide a DNA sample.
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by 9-21-2017.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied if applicable. 

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court with Defendant Broderick A Moore, in custody.  Daniel Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial, however parties would like to proceed with a plea hearing instead.  Jury trial date of 9-26-2016 is vacated.

AS TO COUNT 1 AND 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Received and filed, State's Requested Jury Instructions and Witness List.
Received and filed, Defendant's Requested Jury Instructions and Witness List.
Received and filed State's Motion in Limine.
Recieved and filed. Defendant's Motion in Limine.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant Broderick A Moore not in court, in custody.  Katherine Seelow for Daniel Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for final pre trial, however defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant Broderick A Moore not in court, in custody.  Daniel Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Case in court for plea hearing, defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 26, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant Broderick A Moore not in court, in custody.  Katherine Seelow for Zachary Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm
Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests projected guilty plea date. Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant Broderick A Moore not in court, in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for status, defense requests more time.  Defendant has pending charges in Branch 35.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Status conference scheduled for May 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant Broderick A Moore not in court, in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea hearing, defense does not want to enter a plea but rather set for status following case # 15CF4236.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Status conference scheduled for April 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum signed and filed.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant Broderick A Moore not in court, in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status of counsel.  Defense requests more time to review case.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Broderick A Moore in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Broderick A Moore in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Opland Dobs informs court that there has been a breakdown in communication that is irreconcilable.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Jury trial date of 11/18/2015 is vacated. Case is adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 22.  Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs in court, defendant Broderick A Moore not in court, in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Case in court for final pre-trial.  Defendant was not produced.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum signed and filed.
Motion to withdraw as counsel received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Broderick A Moore in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Broderick A Moore in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
For reasons stated on the record, the Court grants the Defense motion to adjourn jury trial.  Jury trial scheduled for 08/31/2015 is vacated.  Order for Crime Lab Testing received and filed.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Witness list - defendant received and filed.
Defendant's Jury instructions received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Broderick A Moore in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for Nicholas Cerwin for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Court granted defense request. Parties advised effective August 1, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22, Room 608 of the Courthouse. Case adjourned to branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Broderick A Moore in court.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Atty. Opland-Dobs is in trial in Branch 2. Case calendared for SCHEDULING on 6/11/2015 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.
Justice Point Report received and filed. sab

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Stark.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Watts, Br. 15.

Defendant Broderick A Moore in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs. Paul Hauer for Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: City of Milwaukee Police Department Detective Ronald Linzmeyer. Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #14CF4236 that are attached to the complaint. Exhibit 1 received into evidence. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed; defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Exhibit 1 withdrawn. Case is adjourned to Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Broderick A Moore in court with attorney Jamie Cimpl Wiemer for Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Hanna Kolberg for Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State is requesting an adjournment, officer did not appear for today's proceedings. State did inform the Court and Defense Counsel that they are in receipt of Certified Documents regarding case #14CF4236.  Defense Counsel makes no argument as to an adjournment at this time.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 5/13/15.

15RM024167  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05/07/2015

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Broderick A Moore in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Broderick A Moore in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge STARK, Branch 17.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
